intro: Holographis ehrenbergiana, commonly known as the desert star cactus, is a species of flowering plant native to the arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its spiny, globular stems and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant is adapted to survive in extreme drought conditions, storing water in its thick, fleshy stems. Its unique morphology makes it a striking addition to desert landscapes. Holographis ehrenbergiana is also valued for its ecological role in providing habitat and nectar to local pollinators.
